findings.title: Assets can be withdrawn even if the contract is Paused
findings.description: The redeemWithoutCompound() function does not have a whenNotPaused() modifier, allowing assets to be withdrawn even when the contract is paused.

findings.title: .call() should be preferred instead of transfer()
findings.description: The emergencyRetrieve function uses the .transfer() method to initiate a transfer of ether from the contract to the recipient address, which may fail if the recipient is a smart contract that requires more than 2300 gas.

findings.title: Return Value of an External Call is not used effectively
findings.description: The external calls made do return a boolean value that indicates whether or not the external call made was successful. However, the contract never uses these return values throughout the contract.

findings.title: Absence of Zero Address Validation in emergencyRetrieve() function
findings.description: The emergencyRetrieve() function allows the transfer of native tokens to a specific recipient address without validating if the address is zero.

findings.title: Constant declaration should be preferred
findings.description: State variables that are not supposed to change throughout the contract should be declared as constant.

findings.title: Coding Style Issues in the Contract
findings.description: Code readability of a Smart Contract is largely influenced by the Coding Style issues and in some specific scenarios may lead to bugs in the future.
